label.value: indirectly restructure the physical environment BCT

definition.value: A <restructure the physical environment BCT> that changes the person's environment at a time or location other than when and where the behaviour is performed.

label.value: reduce exposure to cues for the behaviour BCT

definition.value: An <alter external stimulus BCT> that reduces an external stimulus that signals the behaviour.

The reduction in exposure can be gradual, as in the technique of "fading" or not so gradual. This BCT is concerned with reducing the person's exposure to the cue, while the cue frequency may remain unchanged. In contrast, "reduce cue frequency BCT" is concerned with a reduction in the number of times with which the cue is presented. This BCT may also involve 'restructure the physical environment BCT' and/or 'restructure the social environment BCT'.

label.value: advise distraction BCT

definition.value: A <manage mental processes BCT> that advises the person to find an alternative focus for attention in order to avoid internal or external states or events associated with an unwanted behaviour.

label.value: provide distraction BCT

definition.value: A <restructure the physical environment BCT> that organises an alternative focus for attention for the person to avoid internal or external states or events associated with an unwanted behaviour.

label.value: add objects to the environment BCT

definition.value: A <restructure the physical environment BCT> that adds objects to the person's physical surroundings.

Provision of information (e.g. written, verbal, visual) in a booklet or leaflet is insufficient. If this is accompanied by social support, also code 'social support BCT' or one of its child classes. If the environment is changed beyond the addition of objects, also code 'directly restructure the physical environment BCT' and/or 'indirectly restructure the physical environment BCT'.

label.value: prompt focus on self-identity BCT

definition.value: A <behaviour change technique> that prompts the person to focus on their mental representation of themself.

label.value: identify self as role model BCT

definition.value: A <prompt focus on self-identity BCT> that informs the person that their behaviour may be an example to others.

label.value: affirm valued self-identity BCT

definition.value: A <prompt focus on self-identity BCT> that advises engagement in activities that affirm the person's valued attributes.

label.value: adopt changed self-identity BCT

definition.value: A <prompt focus on self-identity BCT> that promotes the adoption of a self-identity as someone who engages in the behaviour that is different from their previous behaviour.

label.value: adopt positive self-identity BCT

definition.value: A <prompt focus on self-identity BCT> that promotes the adoption of a positive self-identity as someone who currently engages in the behaviour.

label.value: add objects to the directly experienced environment BCT

definition.value: An <add objects to the environment BCT> that adds an object to the person’s directly experienced environment at the time the behaviour is, or would have been, performed.

label.value: add objects to the indirectly experienced environment BCT

definition.value: An <add objects to the environment BCT> that adds an object to the person’s environment at a time or location other than when and where the behaviour is performed.

label.value: advise behavioural ways to change emotions BCT

definition.value: An <advise how to change emotions BCT> that suggests the person perform a particular behaviour to change an emotion.

label.value: advise cognitive ways to change emotions BCT

definition.value: An <advise how to change emotions BCT> that suggests the person deliberately use a particular mental process.

The target of the mental process advised by this BCT will be an emotion. If a BCT suggests adopting a different cognitive perspective on behaviour, which then changes emotions, use "suggest different perspective on behaviour BCT" or one of its child classes. A mental process is something that occurs in the brain, and that can of itself be conscious, or can give rise to a process that can of itself be conscious or can give rise to behaviour.

label.value: advise sensory ways to change emotions BCT

definition.value: An <advise how to change emotions BCT> that suggests the person use a method that stimulates one or more senses.
advise to use aromatherapy to reduce stress
advise to listen to up-tempo music to increase happiness

label.value: advise specific behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <behaviour change technique> that advises the person to perform a behaviour in a particular way to help change the target behaviour.
In this BCT, the behaviour the person is advised to perform may not necessarily be the target behaviour, but performing the advised behaviour is thought to help change the targeted behaviour.

label.value: context-specific non-enactment of behaviour BCT

definition.value: An <advise specific behaviour BCT> that advises the person to refrain from engaging in the behaviour in a specified context.
For the purposes of this BCT, preceding behaviour can be considered part of the context

label.value: expose to sustained aversive stimulus BCT

definition.value: An <expose to stimulus BCT> that involves sustained exposure to an aversive stimulus to reduce the likelihood of the behaviour when encountering that stimulus.

label.value: facilitate alternative goal-directed activity BCT

definition.value: A <goal directed BCT> that enables the person to engage in an alternative rewarding behaviour that increases the likelihood of goal achievement.

label.value: gradually increase exposure to aversive stimulus BCT

definition.value: An <expose to stimulus BCT> that involves gradually increasing exposure to an aversive stimulus to reduce the likelihood of the behaviour when encountering that stimulus.

label.value: increase awareness of behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <behaviour change technique> that draws attention to the behaviour.

This class concerns raising awareness of the behaviour itself.  Where a BCT increases awareness of the consequences of behaviour, rather than the behaviour itself, use "increase awareness of consequences BCT" or one of its child classes

label.value: increase awareness of option of novel behaviour BCT

definition.value: An <increase awareness of behaviour BCT> that draws attention to the possibility of performing a novel behaviour.
This class concerns raising awareness of a novel behaviour that one might not have known was an option. If not a novel behaviour, consider "suggest how to perform behaviour BCT".

label.value: increase salience of behaviour BCT

definition.value: An <increase awareness of behaviour BCT> that makes the possibility of performing the behaviour more distinctive or prominent.

label.value: inform about environmental consequences BCT

definition.value: An <increase awareness of consequences BCT> that provides information about the environmental consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.
emphasising importance of consequences is not sufficient.
Consequences can be for any target, not just the recipient(s) of the intervention

label.value: inform about negative emotional consequences BCT

definition.value: An <inform about emotional consequences BCT> that provides information about the negative emotional consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: inform about negative environmental consequences BCT

definition.value: An <inform about environmental consequences BCT> that provides information about the negative environmental consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: inform about negative health consequences BCT

definition.value: An <inform about health consequences BCT> that provides information about the negative physical or mental health consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: inform about negative social consequences BCT

definition.value: An <inform about social consequences BCT> that provides information about the negative social consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: inform about positive emotional consequences BCT

definition.value: An <inform about emotional consequences BCT> that provides information about the positive emotional consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: inform about positive environmental consequences BCT

definition.value: An <inform about environmental consequences BCT> that provides information about the positive environmental consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: inform about positive health consequences BCT

definition.value: An <inform about health consequences BCT> that provides information about the positive physical or mental health consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: inform about positive social consequences BCT

definition.value: An <inform about social consequences BCT> that provides information about the positive social consequences of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: manage mental processes BCT

definition.value: A <behaviour change technique> that advises how to manage mental processes to facilitate the behaviour.
A mental process is something that occurs in the brain, and that can of itself be conscious, or can give rise to a process that can of itself be conscious or can give rise to behaviour.

label.value: outcome consequence BCT

definition.value: A <behaviour change technique> that alters the consequences or promised consequences for an outcome that results from performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: promise consequence for behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <behavioural consequence BCT> that promises a future consequence contingent on performing or not performing the behaviour.
"promises" here means assuring someone that one will do something or that something will happen.

label.value: promise to remove consequence for behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <behavioural consequence BCT> that promises future removal of a consequence contingent on performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: promise aversive consequence for behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise consequence for behaviour BCT> where the consequence is aversive.
To qualify as aversive, the consequence should be aversively valued by the person receiving it.

label.value: promise to remove aversive consequence for behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise to remove consequence for behaviour BCT> where the consequence is aversive.

label.value: promise aversive consequence for situation specific behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise aversive consequence for behaviour BCT> that promises the consequence will be provided for the behaviour in one situation but not in another.

label.value: promise aversive material consequence for behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise aversive consequence for behaviour BCT> where the consequence is money, vouchers or other valued objects.

label.value: promise aversive material consequence for situation specific behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise aversive consequence for situation specific behaviour BCT> in which the consequence is money, vouchers or other valued objects.

label.value: promise aversive material consequence for outcome of behaviour

definition.value: A <promise aversive consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT> where the consequence is money, vouchers or other valued objects.

label.value: promise aversive consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT> where the consequence is aversive.

label.value: promise to remove aversive consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise to remove consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT> where the consequence is aversive.

label.value: promise aversive social consequence for behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise aversive consequence for behaviour BCT> where the consequence is an interpersonal process or a proxy interpersonal process.
A proxy interpersonal process is where the person interacts with a chatbot, digital assistant, or similar computer program designed to simulate and process human communication

label.value: promise aversive social consequence for situation specific behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise aversive consequence for situation specific behaviour BCT> in which the consequence is an interpersonal process or a proxy interpersonal process.
A proxy interpersonal process is where the person interacts with a chatbot, digital assistant, or similar computer program designed to simulate and process human communication

label.value: promise aversive social consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise aversive consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT> where the consequence is an interpersonal process or a proxy interpersonal process.
A proxy interpersonal process is where the person interacts with a chatbot, digital assistant, or similar computer program designed to simulate and process human communication

label.value: promise consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT

definition.value: An <outcome consequence BCT> that promises a future consequence contingent on an outcome of performing or not performing the behaviour.
"promises" here means assuring someone that one will do something or that something will happen.

label.value: promise to remove consequence for outcome of behaviour BCT

definition.value: An <outcome consequence BCT> that promises future removal of a consequence contingent on an outcome of performing or not performing the behaviour.

label.value: promise positive consequence for behaviour BCT

definition.value: A <promise consequence for behaviour BCT> where the consequence is positive.

To qualify as positive, the consequence should be positively valued by the person receiving it. If consequence is delivered, also code 'provide positive consequence for behaviour BCT' or one of its child classes.
